ARABIC: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن نَّبِىٍّ إِلَّا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: But no Prophet came to them without their mocking him;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: But never did a prophet come at whom they did not scoff.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Yet never did a Prophet come to them but they mocked him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: No Prophet came to them whom they did not mock.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And whenever any Prophet came to them, they only mocked at him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And never came there a Prophet to them but they used to mock at him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And there came not to them a prophet but they mocked at him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: but not a Prophet came to them, without they mocked at him;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And never came there unto them a prophet but they used to mock him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: but whenever a prophet came to them, they mocked him,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And not a prophet came Unto them but him they were wont to mock.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: There did not come to them any prophet but that they used to deride him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And never came there a prophet to them but they mocked him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And never came there a Prophet to them but they used to mock at him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: no Prophet came to them except that they mocked him,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: No messenger came to them, but they ridiculed him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: But there would not come to them a prophet except that they used to ridicule him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [43:7] And never did a prophet come to them but that they used to deride him, in the same way that your people deride you — this [statement] is intended to comfort the Prophet (s).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And never came there unto them) i.e. to these past nations (a Prophet but they used to mock him) i.e. they used to mock the Prophet.
